reviewText: Good DVD, with some flexibility of what you want to do on a day. As one with 20 or so exercise DVDs who doesn't do communal gyms--this is one way to get what I need without having the competition of a gym.
summary: Good DVD for older exercisers too--Kathy doesn't disappoint
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow! This workout is super duper cool!Man, Kathy will always be my main girl!First off, you get two 20 minute workouts, an upper and lower body, that's a great substitute for Cathe Friedrich's stuff that's forever and a day long. I'm telling you, you get the same muscle soreness in Kathy's 20 minutes that you get in Cathe's 68 minutes on so on...I started off on Cathe's STS, which works like magic to strengthen you up, and it got me hooked on pushups, but those workouts are too long and some of the exercises I can't do. So I don't recommend STS because it's too expensive, too long, and not all of the exercises you'll be able to do. Not to mention that you need a fully equipped home gym with all sorts of stuff to roll with Cathe. Which isn't really necessary.So I'm adding a lot of short 10 to 20 minute workouts to my workout library, because I found that the shorter workouts are just as effective but in less time which means a greater probability of sticking to regular exercise. Even on days when you rather get shot than to lift a leg. Come on, 10 to 20 minutes won't kill you, and you'll feel better and stronger after you do it.Now don't get me wrong, the lower body portion of this Timeless collection isn't as potent as Cathe's Legs and Glutes that's 51 minutes of leg strengthening phenomenon, but in 20 minutes, you're surely good to go! Legs and Glutes is so potent, that you shouldn't try to pull that off no more than once a week. So Kathy's lower body portion is suitable to do everyday if you want. It contains several of the moves in Legs and Glutes, and I'm madly in love with it!And you also get like a 7 min ab workout that'll get your abs sore too! If you put a little squishy ball or peanut ball under your lower back, you'll get even greater muscle stimulation. The ab portion is nice, short, and effective.Man... Kathy Smith is one of my main Goddesses!! Girlfriend still knows her stuff! So get this workout! It's a must have! I can do my pushups, and all that stuff in STS in 20 minutes! Cool! You'll love it! And a man can benefit from it by just using dumbbells heavy enough.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have both the Lift Weights to Lose Weight original and 2.  Although the second is probably more effective, and definately clever, I still LOVE the original.  I have never gotten a better work out--not even when I spent an hour at the gym doing "Nautilus".  It's fast pased enough to keep me breathing heavy.I don't have a weight bench, so I use an aerobics step when I need to lay on my back with the weights, and I use a chair (and even a  piano bench once)when it's required for kneeling.  I considered buying a bench, but decided these alternatives worked so well that it wasn't worth the effort, money or storage area to buy the bench.The toning is top quality and the only tape I look forword to doing.  You just can't get a better work out in this amount of time.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I think this is my favorite workout ever.  Targets all muscles and when I have extra time, I do the upper body twice just to really challenge myself.  I am a little disappointed in the quality of the color, but I get the idea and I'm not really watching the DVD for the cinematography.  Great price and fast shipping.  Thanks!

reviewText: Was very disappointed when I found out that the routines did not include a warm up.  I was hoping to use this dvd as a stand alone but now feel I have to do one of my others to make sure I am warmed up.

reviewText: I like all Kathy Smith DVDs.  This is a little more advanced than what I need right now but that's okay as I will save it until I'm at that level.  I am able to do the upper body strength training right now.
